item.title: TxRay: Agentic Postmortem of Live Blockchain Attacks
item.description:
Summary

  • Presents TxRay, an LLM-driven agentic system that reconstructs Anyone-Can-Take (ACT) DeFi exploits from limited evidence (seed transactions), derives evidence-backed root causes, and generates runnable, oracle-validated Proofs-of-Concept (PoCs).
  • Introduces PoCEvaluator, an independent agentic execution-and-review pipeline to assess PoC correctness and quality; reports 92.11% end-to-end reproduction on 114 real incidents and high rates of non-hardcoded PoCs.
  • Demonstrates practical deployment speed (median 40 minutes for root causes, 59 minutes for PoCs) and improves attack imitation coverage versus prior tools (STING, APE).

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Ziyue Wang', 'Jiangshan Yu', 'Kaihua Qin', 'Dawn Song', 'Arthur Gervais', 'Liyi Zhou']
  • Tags: ['DeFi security', 'smart contract exploits', 'postmortem analysis', 'PoC generation', 'LLM-agent tooling']

item.title: Resisting Manipulative Bots in Meme Coin Copy Trading: A Multi-Agent Approach with Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
item.description:
Summary

  • Identifies and analyzes bot-driven manipulation in meme-coin copy trading (front-running, position concealment, sentiment fabrication) as an adversarial threat to naive copiers.
  • Proposes a manipulation-resistant defensive system using a multi-agent architecture powered by a multi-modal LLM with chain-of-thought reasoning to detect and resist manipulators.
  • Evaluates the approach against zero-shot and statistic-driven baselines, reporting improved prediction accuracy and better economic outcomes for copiers under realistic market frictions.

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Yichen Luo', 'Yebo Feng', 'Jiahua Xu', 'Yang Liu']
  • Tags: ['market-manipulation', 'trading-bots', 'MEV/front-running', 'DeFi-security', 'adversarial-ML']
